title: New Champions Should Be Disabled When Playing Ranked
body: I don't know how long the disable should be, but people who lock in a champ that has been released for 30 minutes will lose their lane and pretty much the game. I refrain from playing ranked whenever a new champion is released for about 1-2 weeks because literally no one knows how to play him/her and there are some idiots out there who insta-lock a new champion and feed like hell.

Mastery level 2* mastery level 1 is too low. 16 mastery level 2 champs is the right amount for a player wanting to enter ranked.

(FYI you need to own 16 champs to enter in the first place hence why I said 16.

No. Most people who play new champs in ranked played them in PBE and crush people who don't know the new champ is even out. If you said they should be disabled because their balance state is unknown I might agree, but there is no way they should be disabled because you think their players are inexperienced. Going by that logic, why doesn't the game require at least a lvl 3 mastery of any champ before using them in ranked?
So let PBE players continue to have an advantage by virtue of being a PBE tester?

Most. That doesn't help the people that do exactly what OP is talking about. 

I also refrain from playing ranked after a new champ is released for 2 reasons:
1) Most people don't know how to play him and will feed horribly.
2) Most people don't know how to play AGAINST him and so the few that did play him on PBE crush their lane.

I can't count on my teammates to play him correctly, and I can't count on my teammates to beat him. 

Also, why should we allow the few people that made it on PBE to have an unfair advantage? Something tells me you have a PBE account.

Yes, let's pretend you can definitely count on your teammates to beat any other champion, and play any old champion perfectly.

You know, I play one game with a champ in norms, and then take them to ranked, and do fine. In the case of Sol, I think my first ranked game with him (jungle, after ONE GAME in norms) was ~12/3. Not everyone needs a whole lot of time practicing a champ to do well with them. :P

I come from MMOs, where you have 20-30+ abilities, CDs, mechanics, combos, synergies and all that. League, compared to that, is child's play. ^^

No, champions should be disabled in rank unless you have them owned at rank 2 or higher. Minimal of 16 rank 2 champs to try ranked. (The amount of champs you must own to draft/ranked is 16 anyways)

Rank 2 mastery is not a lot to commit to especially since you want to rank but fully denying a champion from ranked.
Right. As if it wasn't a big enough deterrent to new players to grind to level 30, buy all the runes, and have enough champions. I wouldn't be opposed to this, but with maybe 8 champions.
You already need to own 16 champions to do draft in the first place it's just increasing it to rank 2 for ranked exclusively.

Like I said before, players are already annoyed with the "grind games until you hit 30, then spend all your ip on runes, then spend all your ip on champs" approach. Last thing we need to add is a system that says, now you need to play 5 games with each of the 16 champions.

The reason it's 16 champions is so you don't get banned out. If you were last pick, you have: the 3 bans from each side, then 9 players picking before you. Hypothetically you could not have a champion when it was your turn.

That said, I don't like the idea of mastery gating ranked either.

I know the logic behind the 16 champions and I am totally fine with that as a requirement. I'm not even entirely opposed to mastery gating. I just think 16 champs at level 2 is excessive. 8 champs at mastery level 2 is totally fine and a lot more reasonable.

But for everyone that made an account after CM was introduced will have rank 2 on the champions they used during levelling. I'd be perfectly happy for them to gate ranked by mastery rank considering riot halved the exp to get to 30 and made the basic tier 3 runes cheap as chips.

If riot said at the end of this season 'From next season only champions you own with  rank 2 mastery or above will be eligible for ranked.' This gives the whole preseason for people to get rank 2 (if you played before CM was introduced).

As to new champions. If you had pbe access then getting wins for a fast rank 2 shouldn't be  a problem. If you didn't then it may take you longer, but you'll learn how the new champion works in the process.

I agree with what you are saying. I don't want to be misunderstood. I am okay for the "you have to have mastery level 2 to play this champ in ranked" approach. I just don't think that you should be required to have 16 champs at mastery 2 before you can join ranked queue. I would like to see this...

You must have 16 champions unlocked AND have 8 of these champions at mastery level 2 before joining ranked queue. Additionally, you must have any additional champion at mastery rank 2 for this champ to be eligible in ranked queues.
the problem with that is when your lv2 champ gets picked/banned and you cant pick a lv1 champ so you are forced to pick your lv2 teemo jungle and lose the game

Hence why there's a minimal 16 rank 2 champ requirement -_-

It's not like draft/ranked doesn't already have a 16 champ minimal requirement to enter anyways it'll make it so players have to play normal games before jumping straight into rank. This is also better than fully disabling a new champ from being pickable in ranked, Plus it'll increase the trust between teammates since you can't just buy and play a champ but get to know the champ before jumping into ranked.

And mastery rank 2 is nothing hard to get I have several mastery 5 champs and mastery 2 is nothing if it was mastery 3+ then it'd be tedious but mastery 2 is just a few games.

So there are no issues of someone getting banned out due to the amount of champions needed in the first place. No issue of new comers not being able to transition since 16 mastery 2 champs isn't hard to do. A great plus of more trust since you'll feel that your teammates did play the champ before entering the ranked game. And it's a better soft ban on new champs/buy and play than outright disabling them.

They should add what SMITE has. You can't play a New god in ranked (atleast the last time I played SMITE you couldn't) for about 3-5 days.

I would say 4 Days - 1 Week would be enough. While I think that people taking new champs into Ranked on release is a problem, I think the bigger issue is the potential bugs or strange interactions they can bring. There should be a bit of time where Riot can potentially hotfix massive bugs without them having an effect on Ranked play. Azir was probably the worst offender in recent years. Bugs included his soldiers not attacking, his Q doing no damage, his Ult breaking turret AI and many more.

If you have a ban that game then ban the new champ. That's what most people do. I don't think that's a good solution to disable them. They want people to play there champions and the best way to learn a champ is to play them competitively. Yea it's probably a good idea to play a normal game or two but I don't really see this as a major problem. I see the solution as more of a problem than the actual problem.

I'm not saying playing against Bots will get you anywhere, but one of the primary reasons Normals exists is to learn new champions. That distinction is why the Free Rotation is enabled for Normals and disabled for Ranked.

i only have like 5 champs at rank 4 or higher  and i play a plethora of different champs in rank, but i try to stay near champs with similar playstyles and similar concepts so its easy to adapt, i DO avoid champs i've never played ever tho. theres a lot of champs i played before the mastery system came out where im only at like rank 1 with them.

i have the same "dont play ranked for 1-2 weeks" when a new champ or huge changes happen, and lets just say it was awful when riot released a new champ every 10 days.

i think riot needs to do 2 things to help fix some issues with champ releases.
First off, a cooldown period that makes the new champion unavailable for ranked for 48 hours. nobody knows how to play as or against the new champ and causes ranked matches to be more luck based than people want them to be.
the 2nd is a special event match where for during the 48 hours of the cooldown period theres a Que that is on the aram map and its just 5v5 of the new champ vs the new champ, everyone gets to play the new champ and try him/her/it out and there won't be as much dodging.
